alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Hall (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 7:10PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Buffalo and northwestern Hall Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 710 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gibbon, or 7 miles northeast of Kearney, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gibbon around 715 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Cairo. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 279 and 281. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central and central Nebraska.
